title: ldlibs compiler flags injection order

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
When setting `ldlibs` for a package or compiler, the link flags are injected by the wrapper script after the flags from the input command. This is different than all other injectable flags (e.g. `cflags`, `cxxflags`, `ldflags`, etc.) and can cause the wrong library to be used when the injected one is intended to override another library.

For example, below I want to install `libxml2` while overriding functions from the standard `libm` with AMD's optimized versions, in `libalm`. However, `-lalm` is ordered after `-lm`; this causes functions in `libm` to be preferred, which is _not_ what is intended.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install libxml2 %aocc ldlibs='-lalm'
...
$ ldd "$(spack location -i libxml2 %aocc ldlibs='-lalm')/lib/libxml2.so"
	linux-vdso.so.1 (0x0000155555551000)
	libdl.so.2 => /lib64/libdl.so.2 (0x0000155554c97000)
	libz.so.1 => /home/omor1/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-zen2/aocc-3.0.0/zlib-1.2.11-omq2fsz3fi4zex2xa2yj2lvluixsyk6x/lib/libz.so.1 (0x000015555538d000)
	liblzma.so.5 => /home/omor1/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-zen2/aocc-3.0.0/xz-5.2.5-enj5mygu7xn3l4wdsuzmpqmwezveumh6/lib/liblzma.so.5 (0x0000155555364000)
	libiconv.so.2 => /home/omor1/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-zen2/aocc-3.0.0/libiconv-1.16-x7c5xwvmdon6mhug7dwmu5eqlpzyicqe/lib/libiconv.so.2 (0x0000155554b9b000)
	libm.so.6 => /lib64/libm.so.6 (0x0000155554e9b000)
	libalm.so => /home/omor1/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-zen/gcc-8.3.1/aocc-3.0.0-4tflgtbenvsdjuq4nzlb5n2zmvlmxf6y/lib/libalm.so (0x000015555521d000)
	libc.so.6 => /lib64/libc.so.6 (0x00001555547d8000)
	/lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x000015555532b000)
	libpthread.so.0 => /lib64/libpthread.so.0 (0x00001555545b8000)
```

### Information on your system

```console
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.1-2358-91845956ba
* **Python:** 3.9.4
* **Platform:** linux-centos8-zen2
* **Concretizer:** original
```

```yaml
compilers.yaml

compilers:
- compiler:
    spec: gcc@8.3.1
    paths:
      cc: /usr/bin/gcc
      cxx: /usr/bin/g++
      f77: /usr/bin/gfortran
      fc: /usr/bin/gfortran
    flags:
      cflags: -O2
      cxxflags: -O2
      fflags: -O2
    operating_system: centos8
    target: x86_64
    modules: []
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
- compiler:
    spec: aocc@3.0.0
    paths:
      cc: /home/omor1/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-zen/gcc-8.3.1/aocc-3.0.0-4tflgtbenvsdjuq4nzlb5n2zmvlmxf6y/bin/clang
      cxx: /home/omor1/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-zen/gcc-8.3.1/aocc-3.0.0-4tflgtbenvsdjuq4nzlb5n2zmvlmxf6y/bin/clang++
      f77: /home/omor1/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-zen/gcc-8.3.1/aocc-3.0.0-4tflgtbenvsdjuq4nzlb5n2zmvlmxf6y/bin/flang
      fc: /home/omor1/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-zen/gcc-8.3.1/aocc-3.0.0-4tflgtbenvsdjuq4nzlb5n2zmvlmxf6y/bin/flang
    flags:
      cflags: -O2 -fveclib=AMDLIBM -Wno-unused-command-line-argument -mllvm -eliminate-similar-expr=false
      cxxflags: -O2 -fveclib=AMDLIBM -Wno-unused-command-line-argument -mllvm -eliminate-similar-expr=false
      fflags: -O2 -fveclib=AMDLIBM -Wno-unused-command-line-argument -mllvm -eliminate-similar-expr=false
      ldlibs: -lalm -lm
    operating_system: centos8
    target: x86_64
    modules: []
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
```

### Additional information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output

### Solutions

If this ordering is needed, passing the flags in `ldflags` instead of `ldlibs` might be sufficient. The proper solution is to inject `SPACK_LDLIBS` before the input flags in the `cc` script:
```diff
diff --git a/lib/spack/env/cc b/lib/spack/env/cc
index 4d8c4644cb..7ffac0c90c 100755
--- a/lib/spack/env/cc
+++ b/lib/spack/env/cc
@@ -545,14 +555,14 @@ case "$mode" in
         ;;
 esac
 
-# Other arguments from the input command
-args+=("${other_args[@]}")
-
 # Inject SPACK_LDLIBS, if supplied
 for lib in "${libs[@]}"; do
     args+=("-l$lib");
 done
 
+# Other arguments from the input command
+args+=("${other_args[@]}")
+
 full_command=("$command" "${args[@]}")
```

However, I'm concerned this might cause other, hidden issues that might be hard to debug later—in some use cases, at least. Maybe providing an alternative `override_ldlibs` parameter might be useful for making this use case clear?
